Another fascinating choice is "Hitch" (2005), which offers a unique perspective on one of the most famous encounters in cinema history between Alfred Hitchcock and François Truffaut. Enjoy your movie time!

I'd recommend "The Trouble with Harry" for you. This comedy-mystery film from the 50s is a light-hearted take on the discovery of a dead body in a small town, featuring an ensemble cast including Jerry Mathers and Alfred Hitchcock. It might be a refreshing choice if you're unsure about Pan's Labyrinth due to its darker tone.

If you're looking for something more recent, "What If..." is an atmospheric romance set under the Athenian night sky, starring Kristy Swanson and John Ratzenberger. It could provide a thought-provoking exploration of fate and decision-making.
